definition: concerning
sentence: I read a story about a brave little mouse.

definition: following in time
sentence: We can play outside after we finish our homework.

definition: any of a family (Formicidae) of colonial hymenopterous insects with a complex social organization and various castes performing special duties
sentence: The ant is carrying food to its nest.

definition: to say or write something to someone as a way of gaining information : to request an answer to a question —often + about —often + if or whether —often + why, what, etc. —often + about
sentence: I need to ask a question.

definition: a usually flexible container that may be closed for holding, storing, or carrying something: such as
sentence: I packed my lunch in a brown paper bag this morning.

definition: exist
sentence: To be or not to be.

definition: a piece of furniture on or in which to lie and sleep
sentence: I make my bed every morning before going to school.

definition: a male child
sentence: The boy kicked the soccer ball across the field during recess.

definition: any of an order (Hemiptera and especially its suborder Heteroptera) of insects (such as an assassin bug or chinch bug) that have sucking mouthparts, forewings thickened at the base, and incomplete metamorphosis and are often economic pests —called also true bug
sentence: A tiny bug crawled across the sidewalk near the playground.

definition: a sweet or plain small bread; especially : a round roll
sentence: Rumor has it, she has a bun in the oven.

definition: to get (something) by paying money for it : purchase
sentence: We need to buy groceries for the week.

definition: a head covering especially with a visor and no brim
sentence: Went cap in hand to the governor to seek more funds for education.

definition: porcelain; also : vitreous porcelain wares (such as dishes, vases, or ornaments) for domestic use
sentence: Pandas come from the forests of China.

definition: the doing of a thing : deed
sentence: Please learn the new rules and act accordingly.

definition: the amount of time during which a person or animal has lived —often used before another noun
sentence: My grandmother is eighty years of age and still very active.

definition: earlier than the present time
sentence: I learned to ride a bike two years ago.

definition: the invisible mixture of gases (such as nitrogen and oxygen) that surrounds the Earth and that people and animals breathe
sentence: The air is fresh in the mountains.

definition: in a line matching the length or direction of; also : at a point or points on
sentence: As we waited, I chatted with lawmakers … who were along for the ride.

definition: one or more
sentence: Do you have any crayons I can borrow?

definition: a human upper limb; especially : the part between the shoulder and the wrist
sentence: She hurt her arm playing tennis.

definition: something that is created with imagination and skill and that is beautiful or that expresses important ideas or feelings
sentence: The art proved to be very useful.

definition: the rear part of the body : the part of the body that is opposite to the stomach and chest and that goes from the neck to the top of the legs
sentence: She was carrying her little daughter on her back.

definition: low or poor in quality
sentence: The storm caused bad damage to the roof.

definition: to cook by dry heat especially in an oven
sentence: Mom and I will bake chocolate chip cookies for the school party.

definition: a vehicle that has four wheels and an engine and that is used for carrying passengers on roads —often used before another noun —called also (US) automobile
sentence: Traveled to Boston by car.

definition: a carnivorous mammal (Felis catus) long domesticated as a pet and for catching rats and mice
sentence: Some young … cat asked me to go drinking with him ….

definition: the mature female of cattle (genus Bos)
sentence: The cow produced fresh milk for the local dairy.

definition: a male parent : father —often used as a name
sentence: My mom swam and played soccer, my dad surfed, and my brother played basketball.

definition: a period of 24 hours beginning at midnight : one of the seven time periods that make up a week
sentence: We're open seven days a week, 365 days a year.

definition: a type of animal that is often kept as a pet or trained to work for people by guarding buildings, hunting, etc. —often used before another noun
sentence: The dog wagged its tail happily.

definition: the part of the body that you hear with
sentence: He was whispering something in her ear.

definition: consume food
sentence: We eat lunch together in the cafeteria at twelve o'clock.

definition: the hard-shelled reproductive body produced by a bird and especially by the common domestic chicken; also : its contents used as food
sentence: She cracked an egg into the mixing bowl very carefully.

definition: a point that marks the limit of something : the point at which something no longer continues to happen or exist
sentence: The end proved to be very useful.

definition: evening
sentence: Christmas eve is a magical time for all families.

definition: move through air
sentence: Birds can fly high in the sky with their strong wings.

definition: any of various carnivorous mammals (especially genus Vulpes) of the dog family related to but smaller than wolves with shorter legs, more pointed muzzle, large erect ears, and long bushy tail
sentence: The fox lives in the forest.

definition: for the reason that
sentence: But the Conservatives voted against the amendment—because politics. And so did the Liberals.

definition: the flesh of an adult domestic bovine (such as a steer or cow) used as food
sentence: Security around the city will be beefed up during the event.

definition: earlier than
sentence: Please wash your hands before you eat dinner.

definition: a long and usually hard seat for two or more people
sentence: We sat on the park bench.

definition: large in size
sentence: We live in a big house with five bedrooms.

definition: bicycle
sentence: I ride my bike to the park with my friends on Saturdays.

definition: an animal that has wings and is covered with feathers
sentence: The bird sang a beautiful song at dawn.

definition: a set of printed sheets of paper that are held together inside a cover : a long written work —sometimes used figuratively
sentence: Tried to make reservations, but they were all booked up.

definition: a rigid typically rectangular container with or without a cover : such as
sentence: For something a bit more suited to everyday, you can also pull your box braids into a high ponytail.

definition: a large motor vehicle designed to carry passengers usually along a fixed route according to a schedule
sentence: The yellow school bus picks me up at eight o'clock each morning.

definition: a sweet baked food made from a mixture of flour, sugar, and other ingredients (such as eggs and butter) —often used before another noun
sentence: I made/baked three cakes for the party.

definition: a seat for one person that has a back and usually four legs
sentence: Please sit in your chair and finish your homework.

definition: to break a rule or law usually to gain an advantage at something —often + on or at
sentence: The players were accused of cheating.

definition: a shout of applause or encouragement
sentence: With autumn approaching, evenings at Stringham Pitcher Park are again alive with the sounds of football and cheer.

definition: a young person —often used before another noun.
sentence: The child learned to ride a bicycle.

definition: a place where people live that is larger or more important than a town : an area where many people live and work
sentence: New York is a big city.

definition: to move so as to bar passage through something
sentence: Please close the door when you leave the classroom.

definition: to move toward someone or something
sentence: Please come here for a minute. I want to show you something.

definition: someone who prepares and cooks food for eating at home, in a restaurant, etc.
sentence: My dad is a great cook who makes delicious pasta every Sunday.

definition: to lay (oneself) down for rest or sleep
sentence: The tiger couches in the thick grass, watching its prey move closer.

definition: to utter loudly : shout
sentence: You made a mistake, but there's no use crying over spilled milk.

definition: a small round container that often has a handle and that is used for drinking liquids (such as tea and coffee)
sentence: Please give me a cup of water.

definition: to use a sharp tool (such as a knife) to open or divide (something, such as paper or wood) —sometimes used figuratively
sentence: Cut the paper along/on the dotted line (with a pair of scissors).

definition: to move your body in a way that goes with the rhythm and style of music that is being played
sentence: He never learned how to dance.

definition: to break up, turn, or loosen (earth) with an implement
sentence: My dog likes to dig holes in the backyard to hide his bones.

definition: the fourth month of the Gregorian calendar
sentence: My birthday is in April, right after spring starts.

definition: make pictures
sentence: I like to draw pictures of my family and pets with crayons.

definition: consume liquid
sentence: Remember to drink water after playing outside in the sun.

definition: a musical instrument that is made with a thin layer of skin or plastic stretched over the end of a round frame and that is played by hitting the skin or plastic with sticks or with your hands
sentence: A child beating on a drum.

definition: any one of many different kinds of birds that swim and have a flat beak, a short neck, a heavy body, short legs, and webbed feet—often used before another noun
sentence: The duck paddled across the pond.

definition: to take pleasure in (something)
sentence: Did you enjoy the movie?

definition: the front part of the head that has the eyes, nose, and mouth on it
sentence: Wash your face with soap and water before bedtime.

definition: any of various devices for winnowing grain
sentence: I am a big fan of the school basketball team.

definition: at or to a great distance in space or time
sentence: The dog wandered far from home.

definition: a sum or due fixed in amount and payable at fixed intervals
sentence: There was a trend of people farming likes on TikTok to get their significant others to buy them the game.

definition: to be aware of (something that affects you physically, such as pain, heat, or an object touching your body)
sentence: I feel much better after a good night's sleep.

definition: a number equal to five times 10
sentence: There are fifty states in the United States of America.

definition: to discover (something or someone) without planning or trying to : to discover (something or someone) by chance
sentence: The artist loses himself in his experience and finds himself in it again.

definition: a cold-blooded animal that lives in water, breathes with gills, and usually has fins and scales
sentence: The fish swam gracefully through the clear water.

definition: to make something whole or able to work properly again : repair, mend
sentence: It was obvious early in the game that the fix was in.

definition: the things that people and animals eat
sentence: A farmer who grows his own food.

definition: the part of the leg on which an animal or person stands and moves : the part of the leg below the ankle —often used before another noun
sentence: The foot is a fascinating creature to observe.

definition: an implement with two or more prongs used especially for taking up (as in eating), pitching, or digging
sentence: Use your fork to eat the salad and your spoon for soup.

definition: a number equal to four times 10
sentence: Kelvin finished his forty in seven or eight long gulps. Tossed the bottle in the median carpeted with brown grass.

definition: the number 4
sentence: A square has four sides and a table has four legs.

definition: either continent (North America or South America) of the western hemisphere
sentence: The Statue of Liberty is in America.

definition: a native or inhabitant of China
sentence: My friend is teaching me some Chinese words.

definition: a feast that commemorates Christ's resurrection and is observed with variations of date due to different calendars on the first Sunday after the paschal full moon
sentence: We hunt for colorful eggs on Easter Sunday morning.

definition: the day of the week between Thursday and Saturday —abbr. Fri.
sentence: We have art class every Friday afternoon after lunch.

definition: one that acts : doer
sentence: My favorite actor played a superhero in the new movie.

definition: to concur in (something, such as an opinion) : admit, concede
sentence: He likes golf and his wife likes tennis, so when it comes to sports, they have agreed to disagree.

definition: in addition
sentence: I like pizza, and my sister also likes it.

definition: a living thing that is not a human being or plant —often used to refer specifically to mammals as distinguished from other living things (such as fish and birds)
sentence: The bay was home to clams, fish, dolphins, and other aquatic animals.

definition: something you say or write when someone asks you a question
sentence: The answer proved to be very useful.

definition: a round fruit with red, yellow, or green skin and firm white flesh —often used before another noun
sentence: Is the epitome of apple-pie wholesomeness.

definition: a part or section within a larger place : region
sentence: This question falls outside my area of expertise.

definition: the sister of one's father or mother
sentence: My aunt visited us from overseas last weekend for a week.

definition: a very young child —often used before another noun
sentence: She had the baby yesterday.

definition: a place for baking or selling baked goods
sentence: The bakery sells fresh bread and pastries every day.

definition: a platform that projects from the wall of a building and is enclosed by a parapet or railing
sentence: We watched the beautiful sunset from the balcony of the hotel.

definition: cleric

definition: the property of objects that produce sensations on the eye
sentence: The color of the sky is blue.

definition: father
sentence: He's the Big Daddy of Spanish filmmakers ….

definition: to stop living
sentence: She claims she's not afraid to die.

definition: a small-scale figure of a human being used especially as a child's plaything
sentence: Generic, blue-eyed, blonde Barbie dolls with orthodontically perfect teeth ….

definition: to put clothes on (yourself or someone else)
sentence: They dressed themselves in a hurry.

definition: to frighten or prod (game, cattle, etc.) into moving in a desired direction
sentence: The school held a food drive.

definition: the number 5
sentence: I have five fingers on each hand and five toes on each foot.

definition: an elongated usually tapering tropical fruit with soft pulpy flesh enclosed in a soft usually yellow rind
sentence: I eat a banana with my cereal for breakfast every morning.

definition: a usually small group of musicians who play popular music together
sentence: The band's drummer is also the lead singer.

definition: a business where people keep their money, borrow money, etc., or the building where such a business operates —often used before another noun
sentence: Our paychecks are deposited in/into the bank automatically.

definition: an area covered with sand or small rocks that is next to an ocean or lake
sentence: We spent the day at the beach.

definition: fava bean
sentence: Green bean is my favorite vegetable to eat with dinner.

definition: any one of a group of large and heavy animals that have thick hair and sharp claws and that can stand on two legs like a person —sometimes used figuratively to describe a large man
sentence: A mother bear and her cubs.

definition: to do the first part of an action : to start doing something
sentence: They will begin construction on the new school soon.

definition: a strip of flexible material worn especially around the waist as an item of clothing or a means of carrying something (such as tools)
sentence: Dad wears a brown leather belt to keep his pants up.

definition: in the space separating two things
sentence: The library is between the post office and the bank.

definition: to seize especially with teeth or jaws so as to enter, grip, or wound
sentence: In seven previous days, the seller didn't get a single bite.

definition: having the very dark color of coal or the night sky
sentence: My cat has soft black fur and green eyes.

definition: a covering made of cloth that is used especially on a bed to keep you warm
sentence: I snuggle under my warm blanket when I read before bedtime.

definition: to move with speed or force
sentence: The wind was blowing earlier but it's not blowing now.

definition: a small vehicle that is used for traveling on water
sentence: A lot of people still think Cadillac makes big floaty boats.

definition: a person's or animal's whole physical self —often used before another noun
sentence: Exercise helps keep your body strong and healthy.

definition: to come to the boiling point
sentence: After two hit singles, the band went off the boil and eventually disbanded.

definition: a round container that has tall, curving sides and that is used for preparing or serving foods and liquids
sentence: Being bowled over by a base runner.

definition: to separate (something) into parts or pieces often in a sudden and forceful or violent way
sentence: Be careful not to break the expensive vase.

definition: to convey, lead, carry, or cause to come along with one toward the place from which the action is being regarded
sentence: This station brings you the news every night.

definition: having the color of wood or chocolate; especially : of the color brown
sentence: Their hands and faces were brown from long days in the sun.

definition: to make (something) by putting together parts or materials
sentence: They plan to build a new house next year.

definition: hamburger

definition: to consume fuel and give off heat, light, and gases
sentence: A small fire burned on the hearth.

definition: a place that is usually far away from cities and that has tents, small houses, etc., that people can live in for a short period of time
sentence: Fishing camps are located all along the river.

sentence: We put candles on the birthday cake and made a wish.

definition: crystallized sugar formed by boiling down sugar syrup
sentence: Do not eat too much candy.

definition: playing card
sentence: I made a card for my mom on Mother's Day.

definition: suffering of mind : grief
sentence: I care for my puppy by feeding him every morning.

definition: a situation or occurrence that is an instance or example of something

definition: a monetary unit equal to 1/100 of a basic unit of value (such as dollar, euro, rand)

definition: to inspect, examine, or look at appraisingly or appreciatively —usually used with out or over
sentence: Mom will check my spelling test before I turn it in.

definition: a bird that is raised by people for its eggs and meat
sentence: The chicken laid fresh eggs every morning.

definition: free from dirt, marks, etc. : not dirty
sentence: All visitors to the prison are searched to make sure they're clean.

definition: a device that shows what time it is and that is usually placed in a room or attached to a wall —often used before another noun
sentence: She looked/glanced at the clock on the wall. It was now 2:30.

definition: a white or gray mass in the sky that is made of many very small drops of water
sentence: The sun is shining and there's not a cloud in the sky.

definition: a group of people who meet to participate in an activity (such as a sport or hobby)
sentence: I joined the art club at school this semester.

definition: an outer piece of clothing that can be long or short and that is worn to keep warm or dry
sentence: She put on her coat, hat, and gloves, and then she went outside.

definition: having a very low temperature
sentence: The water was too cold for swimming.

definition: of, relating to, or marked by comedy
sentence: I love reading comic books about superheroes on the weekend.

definition: somewhat cold : not warm or hot

definition: an imitation, transcript, or reproduction of an original work (such as a letter, a painting, a table, or a dress)
sentence: The teacher asked us to make a copy of the worksheet.

definition: the price of something : the amount of money that is needed to pay for or buy something
sentence: The original cost of the house was $200,000.

definition: to indicate or name by units or groups so as to find the total number of units involved : number
sentence: If you are looking for people to help you clean the house today, count me out.

definition: an area of land that is controlled by its own government : nation
sentence: She traveled to a foreign country for the first time.

definition: a particular day of a month or year
sentence: The date of the party is March 1.

definition: to concern oneself or itself
sentence: Let's make a deal to share the cookies fairly.

definition: a piece of furniture that is like a table and often has drawers —often used before another noun
sentence: She placed her hand on the desk.

definition: a shallow container that you cook or serve food in; specifically : a shallow bowl
sentence: He can dish it out, but he can't take it when others do the same to him.

definition: a person who is skilled in the science of medicine : a person who is trained and licensed to treat sick and injured people
sentence: I think you should see a doctor.

definition: to a lower position
sentence: The ball rolled down the hill and into the lake.

definition: a series of thoughts, visions, or feelings that happen during sleep
sentence: He had a dream about climbing a mountain.

definition: a very small amount of liquid that falls in a rounded shape —often + of
sentence: He squeezed the bottle until a few drops came out.

definition: free or relatively free from a liquid and especially water
sentence: Hang your wet towel outside in the sun to dry.

definition: throughout

definition: a means or system for transmitting messages electronically (as between computers on a network)
sentence: My teacher sent an e-mail to my parents about the field trip.

definition: to go or come in
sentence: He's been faced with many scandals since he entered office.

definition: one that erases; especially : a device (such as a piece of rubber or a felt pad) used to erase marks (as of ink or chalk)
sentence: Use an eraser to fix mistakes.

definition: a person or way of behaving that is seen as a model that should be followed
sentence: He was inspired by the example of his older brother.

definition: not including (someone or something) : other than (something or someone)
sentence: The stores will be open daily except Sundays.

definition: something that truly exists or happens : something that has actual existence —often used in the phrase the fact that
sentence: Rapid electronic communication is now a fact.

definition: to lose strength : weaken
sentence: Our nation's greatest resource is our youth. … It has … never failed an invincible courage ….

definition: a group of people who are related to each other
sentence: The family gathered for Thanksgiving dinner.

definition: moving or able to move quickly
sentence: The rabbit can run really fast through the grass.

definition: notable for having an unusual amount of fat:
sentence: The author, a doctoral student therapist, discusses her experience with a clinical supervisor who fat-shamed a client during supervision.

definition: to give food to
sentence: I help my mom feed our cat and dog every evening.

definition: a number that is one more than fourteen
sentence: She was fifteen when she first learned to drive.

definition: good, acceptable, or satisfactory : ok
sentence: There's a fine line between helping and intruding.

definition: to come to an end : terminate
sentence: You can play outside after you finish your homework.

definition: the light and heat and especially the flame produced by burning
sentence: The shack was destroyed by a fire. Police think someone set fire to it.

definition: coming before all
sentence: Our team won first place in the competition.

definition: from one side to the opposite side of : over, through
sentence: The restaurant is (just) across from the high school.

definition: a woman or girl who is an actor
sentence: The actress wore a beautiful costume on stage during the play.

definition: to permit (something) : to regard or treat (something) as acceptable
sentence: My teacher will allow us to play outside after we finish our work.

definition: a hollow usually cup-shaped metal object that makes a ringing sound when it is hit
sentence: The school bell rings at three o'clock every day.

definition: having the color of the clear sky
sentence: The sky was a brilliant blue.

definition: the person whose job is to tell other workers what to do
sentence: Why don't you ask your boss for a raise?

definition: to speak in a loud voice
sentence: He called to passersby for help.

definition: to move (something) while holding and supporting it —sometimes used figuratively
sentence: She helped me carry the boxes out to my car.

definition: to use your hands to stop and hold (an object that is moving through the air)
sentence: Catch the ball and throw it to first base.

definition: a soft white, gray, or buff limestone composed chiefly of the shells of foraminifers
sentence: Write with chalk on the board.

definition: a dark brown drink made from ground coffee beans and boiled water —often used before another noun
sentence: My dad drinks a hot cup of coffee every morning before work.

definition: a toothed instrument used especially for adjusting, cleaning, or confining hair

definition: to guard from attack
sentence: The well rounded menu covers all the bases.

definition: a structure consisting of an upright with a transverse beam used especially by the ancient Romans for execution
sentence: Please cross the street carefully.

definition: the main meal of the day —often used before another noun
sentence: We had many pleasant dinners together.

definition: a person who drives a car, truck, etc.
sentence: Who was the driver at the time of the accident?

definition: a number that is one more than 10
sentence: There are exactly eleven players on a soccer team.

definition: all
sentence: I brush my teeth every morning and every night before bed.

definition: to come or go down quickly from a high place or position
sentence: Be careful not to fall on the icy sidewalk.

definition: an Indigenous person of North America or South America
sentence: We learned about American history in our social studies class today.

definition: the eighth month of the year
sentence: School vacation ends in August every year.

definition: the 12th month of the Gregorian calendar
sentence: We celebrate Christmas and New Year in December every year.

definition: of, relating to, or characteristic of England, the English people, or the English language
sentence: We learn English grammar and reading in school every day.

definition: the second month of the Gregorian calendar
sentence: February is the shortest month.

definition: to put into as much as can be held or conveniently contained
sentence: No one will be able to fill your shoes after you retire.

definition: the level base of a room
sentence: On the ground floor, design architects removed some walls to create an open floor plan with lots of light ….

definition: the specialized part of an angiospermous plant that occurs singly or in clusters, possesses whorls of often colorful petals or sepals, and bears the reproductive structures (such as stamens or pistils) involved in the development of seeds and fruit : blossom
sentence: A movement that flowered in the early 21st century.

definition: a person who you like and enjoy being with
sentence: I'd like you to meet my friend.

definition: having the power, skill, money, etc., that is needed to do something —usually followed by to + verb
sentence: Hopes to be able to visit soon.

definition: in or toward the front
sentence: The road stretched ahead for many miles.

definition: a place where aircraft land and take off and where there are buildings for passengers to wait in and for aircraft to be sheltered
sentence: We arrived at the airport just before closing time.

definition: at all times : invariably
sentence: You can always try again if it doesn't work this time.

definition: filled with anger : having a strong feeling of being upset or annoyed —often + at or with —often + about or over
sentence: I've never seen her look so angry.

definition: any person : anyone
sentence: Can anybody help me carry these books?

definition: any person at all
sentence: Is anyone sitting in this chair?

definition: the season between summer and winter comprising in the northern hemisphere usually the months of September, October, and November or as reckoned astronomically extending from the September equinox to the December solstice —called also fall
sentence: From traditional lion dances to eating mooncake, the Autumn Moon Festival brought families together to celebrate a cherished Chinese tradition.

definition: to or at a distance
sentence: The park is just two blocks away from our house.

definition: a receptacle made of interwoven material (such as osiers)
sentence: We collected apples in a big basket at the farm yesterday.

definition: a stout solid stick : club
sentence: We need his bat in the lineup.

definition: a washing or soaking (as in water or steam) of all or part of the body
sentence: My little sister takes a bath with her rubber ducky every night.

definition: to begin to be or come to be something specified : to begin to have a specified quality
sentence: Although I've known him for years, we didn't become close friends until recently.

definition: a room furnished with a bed and intended primarily for sleeping
sentence: I keep my toys in a big box in my bedroom.

definition: any of numerous hymenopterous insects (superfamily Apoidea) that differ from the related wasps especially in the heavier hairier body and in having sucking as well as chewing mouthparts, that feed on pollen and nectar, and that store both and often also honey
sentence: A yellow bee flew around the flowers in our garden.

definition: in the place or situation that is being or has been departed from
sentence: The cat is hiding behind the couch in the living room.

definition: —used to say that someone or something should be in a particular place or situation
sentence: The house belongs not just to her, but to her husband as well.

definition: a 2-wheeled vehicle that a person rides by pushing on foot pedals
sentence: She rode her bicycle to school.

definition: brought forth by or as if by birth
sentence: My baby brother was born in the hospital last spring.

definition: to cease from competition or resistance : submit, yield; also : to suffer defeat
sentence: Whose heavy hand hath bowed you to the grave ….

definition: a boy or man who has one or both of the same parents as you
sentence: My little brother is learning to read in first grade.

definition: engaged in action : occupied
sentence: She has a busy/hectic social life. It seems like there's a party every week.

definition: a device that is used for taking photographs or for making movies, television programs, etc.
sentence: The camera proved to be very useful.

definition: a large fortified building or set of buildings
sentence: The princess lived in a tall castle with many towers.

definition: the middle point or part of something —often used before another noun
sentence: The center proved to be very useful.

definition: an opportunity to do something : an amount of time or a situation in which something can be done —often followed by to + verb
sentence: I wanted to call you, but I never got/had the chance (to).

definition: to become different
sentence: She was wearing a strange smile. … then her smile changed back to the kind one that I recognized ….

definition: not costing a lot of money
sentence: I always buy the cheapest brand of cereal.

definition: a food consisting of the coagulated, compressed, and usually ripened curd of milk separated from the whey
sentence: I like cheese on my pizza.

definition: the act of choosing : the act of picking or deciding between two or more possibilities
sentence: He knew he had to make a choice.

definition: to decide that a particular person or thing is the one that you want
sentence: It's difficult to choose between so many good options.

definition: a building that is used for Christian religious services —often used before another noun
sentence: The church bells rang every Sunday morning.

definition: of, relating to, or resembling cloud
sentence: It is cloudy today, so we might get some rain.

definition: the point or area where two lines, edges, or sides of something meet
sentence: We arrived at the corner just before closing time.

definition: the path or direction that something or someone moves along —often used figuratively
sentence: We're trying to determine the best course of action at this point.

definition: a child of one's uncle or aunt
sentence: Rural children deserve as good an education as their city cousins get.

definition: not mentally sound : marked by thought or action that lacks reason : insane —not used technically
sentence: My little brother is crazy about dinosaurs and toy cars.

definition: clever or shrewd often in an underhanded manner
sentence: The baby puppies at the pet store are so cute.

definition: having very little or no light
sentence: She sat in the dark room alone.

definition: no longer alive or living : no longer having life
sentence: Her husband is dead. He died last year.

definition: loved or valued very much —often + to
sentence: He's a dear friend of mine.

definition: the end of life : the time when someone or something dies
sentence: The scary movie made me scream and scared me to death.

definition: to make a choice about (something) : to choose (something) after thinking about it —often followed by to + verb —often + what, where, whether, if, etc.
sentence: He decided that dinner would be at 7 o'clock, and asked guests to arrive at 6.

definition: having a large distance to the bottom from the surface or highest point —often used figuratively
sentence: We walked in the deep snow.

definition: one who is skilled in and licensed to practice the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases, injuries, and malformations of the teeth, jaws, and mouth and who makes and inserts false teeth
sentence: He goes to the dentist's for a check-up every six months.

definition: not clean
sentence: Your hands are dirty, so wash them before eating lunch.

definition: a small round mark
sentence: Put a dot over the i.

definition: an act or instance of transferring something (such as data or files) from a usually large computer to the memory of another device (such as a smaller computer) : an act or instance of downloading something; also : the item downloaded
sentence: Download the files onto your computer.

definition: every one
sentence: The teacher gave each student a pencil and a notebook.

definition: the planet we live on
sentence: The new planetary system consists of two planets that are about three times larger than Earth ….

definition: to, toward, or in the east
sentence: The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.

definition: not hard to do : not difficult
sentence: This puzzle is too easy for older children.

definition: a thickset, usually extremely large, nearly hairless, herbivorous mammal (family Elephantidae, the elephant family) that has a snout elongated into a muscular trunk and two incisors in the upper jaw developed especially in the male into long ivory tusks:
sentence: The elephant is the largest land animal.

definition: in a different manner or place or at a different time
sentence: I don't like it. Apart from anything else , it's too expensive.

definition: to forgive someone for making a mistake, doing something wrong, etc.,
sentence: Please excuse me for being late to school this morning.

definition: to think that something will probably or certainly happen —often followed by to + verb
sentence: We expect (that) the economy will improve.

definition: to make (something) clear or easy to understand
sentence: I need a lawyer to explain this contract to me.

definition: a building or group of buildings where products are made —often used before another noun —often used figuratively
sentence: We arrived at the factory just before closing time.

definition: known or recognized by very many people : having fame —often + for or as
sentence: A restaurant famous for its French cuisine.

definition: a male parent
sentence: He became a father when he was 30.

definition: to lose the remembrance of : be unable to think of or recall
sentence: She's a talented singer and, lest we forget, a fine musician as well.

definition: a number that is one more than 13
sentence: My brother turned fourteen years old this month.

definition: not costing any money
sentence: They're giving out free tickets to the show.

definition: newly produced, made, gathered, etc. : not preserved by being frozen, canned, etc.
sentence: We bought fresh vegetables from the farmers market this morning.

definition: feeling fear: such as
sentence: She's not afraid of hard work.

definition: a powered heavier-than-air aircraft with fixed wings from which it derives most of its lift
sentence: We watched the airplane fly high above the clouds in the sky.

definition: very nearly but not exactly or entirely
sentence: I almost jumped out of my skin when I heard her say my name.

definition: the difference between the direction of two lines or surfaces that come together : the space or shape formed when two lines or surfaces meet each other
sentence: The two lines form a sharp angle.

definition: to seem to be something : to make someone think that a person or thing has a particular characteristic : look seem —often followed by to + verb
sentence: A performer who first appeared on a television variety show.

definition: to receive with the implied or expressed intention of returning the same or an equivalent
sentence: Borrow a book from the library.

definition: a glass or plastic container that has a narrow neck and usually has no handle
sentence: Slipped deeper and deeper into the bottle ….

definition: the lowest part, point, or level of something—usually singular
sentence: The treasure is at the bottom of the ocean.

definition: feeling or showing no fear : not afraid
sentence: He was a brave soldier.

definition: a structure built over something (such as a river) so that people or vehicles can get across
sentence: A bridge connecting the island to the mainland.

definition: a solid emulsion of fat globules, air, and water made by churning milk or cream and used as food
sentence: I spread butter on my toast for a yummy breakfast treat.

definition: a small, usually round piece of plastic, glass, metal, etc., that is sewn to a piece of clothing and is pushed through a loop or hole to fasten one part of the clothing to another part
sentence: The button proved to be very useful.

definition: a perfectly round shape : a line that is curved so that its ends meet and every point on the line is the same distance from the center
sentence: She drew a circle around the correct answer.

definition: very obvious : not causing or allowing doubt —sometimes used in spoken phrases that express anger
sentence: The show was a clear failure.

definition: to move or go up (something) using your feet and often your hands
sentence: We like to climb the big tree in the backyard.

definition: a short prayer comprising an invocation, petition, and conclusion; specifically often Collect : one preceding the eucharistic Epistle and varying with the day
sentence: I collected up the dishes and brought them to the kitchen.

definition: at or near the beginning of a period of time or a process, activity, series, etc.
sentence: Early in his career he moved to the city.

definition: an enclosing cover for a letter, card, etc.
sentence: Put the letter in an envelope.

definition: used for emphasis
sentence: My little sister can even ride a bike without training wheels.

definition: to contend in battle or physical combat; especially : to strive to overcome a person by blows or weapons
sentence: He will fight for the heavyweight title next month.

definition: to go or come after or behind (someone or something)
sentence: She followed us into the kitchen.

definition: a Christian holiday that is celebrated on December 25 in honor of the birth of Jesus Christ or the period of time that comes before and after this holiday —often used before another noun
sentence: We're spending Christmas with my parents.

definition: prior to a specified or implied past, present, or future time : by this time : previously
sentence: He had already left when I called.

definition: in a circle or in circumference
sentence: The most intelligent of the artists around today.

definition: to come to or reach a place after traveling, being sent, etc.
sentence: He arrived home at six o'clock.

definition: a court game played with light long-handled rackets and a shuttlecock volleyed over a net
sentence: We played badminton on the weekends at the park with friends.

definition: a game played with a bat and ball between two teams of nine players each on a large field having four bases that mark the course a runner must take to score; also : the ball used in this game
sentence: We played baseball in the field after school today.

definition: to accept or regard (something) as true
sentence: I believe in giving people second chances.

definition: by the side of
sentence: A composition that can be ranked beside that of the masters.

definition: a solid piece of material (such as rock or wood) that has flat sides and is usually square or rectangular in shape
sentence: Walk two blocks to the store.

definition: a place of business where books are the main item offered for sale —called also bookshop
sentence: I bought several interesting novels at the bookstore downtown.

definition: a baked food made from a mixture of flour and water —often used before another noun
sentence: We buy fresh bread from the bakery every Saturday morning.

definition: the first meal of the day especially when taken in the morning
sentence: The large kitchen has a long breakfast bar and a sitting area with French doors onto a back deck.

definition: a tool with many stiff hairs, fibers, etc., that is used for cleaning, smoothing, or painting something
sentence: Use a wire brush to get the rust off the metal.

definition: using care
sentence: Careful of a child's welfare.

definition: a group of students who meet regularly to be taught a subject or activity
sentence: There are 20 students in the class.

definition: a member of the same class in a school or college
sentence: My classmate helped me with the difficult homework.

definition: belonging to or shared by two or more people or groups
sentence: Oh hard is the bed they have made him, / And common the blanket and cheap ….

definition: a basic unit of money in the U.S., Canada, Australia, and other countries that is equal to 100 cents
sentence: Inflatable balloons, holiday decorations, toothbrushes and spices are some of the best deals you can buy at the dollar store.

definition: a movable piece of wood, glass, or metal that swings or slides open and shut so that people can enter or leave a room, building, vehicle, etc.
sentence: Please close the door quietly when you leave the classroom.

definition: a group of 12 people or things
sentence: My dad bought a dozen eggs from the grocery store.

definition: a number that is equal to eight times 10
sentence: Sadly, … the heartless bottom-liners on the food committee eighty-sixed the black raspberry for good.

definition: a member of a military group devoted to engineering work
sentence: Corn engineered to resist crop pests.

definition: very enthusiastic and eager about something
sentence: They were excited about/over the trip.

definition: physical activity that is done in order to become stronger and healthier —often used before another noun
sentence: Get plenty of fresh air and exercise.

definition: a tool usually of hardened steel with cutting ridges for forming or smoothing surfaces especially of metal
sentence: The teacher keeps all our art projects in a big blue file.

definition: a person lacking in judgment or prudence
sentence: On April Fools Day, my brother tried to fool me.

definition: beyond the boundaries of one's country : in or to a foreign country
sentence: A family that came here from abroad.

definition: something that a person or group does —often used with take
sentence: As its first official action, the committee elected Ms. Jones as its president.

definition: the part of day between noon and sunset
sentence: Mom picked me up from school this afternoon.

definition: different or distinct from the one first considered
sentence: I'm willing to help you, but if you're asking for money, that's another thing/matter/story.

definition: any thing whatever : any such thing
sentence: Today, in terms of clothing, almost anything goes, but they recall when the dress code was strictly formal.

definition: a room containing a bathtub or shower and usually a sink and toilet
sentence: Wash your hands in the bathroom.

definition: the day of a person's birth
sentence: I got a new bicycle for my birthday this year.

definition: appearing or causing to appear dazed, confounded, or nonplussed
sentence: I tried to remember her name but drew a blank/my mind was a blank.

definition: unable to see
sentence: The blind man uses a white cane to help him walk safely.

definition: filled with or characterized by boredom
sentence: Bobbi slouched back against the cushions doing her best impression of a bored teenager ….

definition: any of numerous slender-bodied diurnal lepidopteran insects including one superfamily (Papilionoidea) with broad often brightly colored wings and usually another superfamily comprising the skippers
sentence: A beautiful butterfly landed on the flower in our garden.

definition: a portable usually cordless telephone for use in a cellular system
sentence: Mom uses her cellphone to call Dad at work.

definition: a unit of length equal to 1/100 meter
sentence: One centimeter equals exactly ten millimeters in measurement.

definition: one of a pair of slender sticks (as of wood or plastic) held between the thumb and fingers and used to lift food to the mouth —usually used in plural
sentence: I am learning how to eat rice with chopsticks.

definition: true or accurate : agreeing with facts : right
sentence: What's the correct answer/response to this question?

definition: a female offspring especially of human parents
sentence: The United States is a daughter of Great Britain.

definition: a box that slides into and out of a piece of furniture (such as a desk) and that is used to store things
sentence: The top/middle/bottom drawer of the desk/dresser.

definition: the number 8
sentence: There are eight crayons in my pencil box right now.

definition: a number that is one more than seventeen
sentence: He turned eighteen this year and got his license.

definition: something that is not correct : a wrong action or statement : mistake
sentence: I made an error in my calculations.

definition: every person : everybody
sentence: Everyone in our class is excited about the school picnic.

definition: a special time or event when people gather to celebrate something
sentence: Each year, a festival was held to celebrate the harvest.

definition: a rise of body temperature above the normal
sentence: I stayed home from school because I had a fever.

definition: located outside a particular place or country and especially outside your own country
sentence: This design is not foreign from some people's thoughts ….

definition: a person belonging to or owing allegiance to a foreign country
sentence: Our new classmate is a foreigner from Japan who speaks Japanese.

definition: in spite of the fact that : even though
sentence: They are good friends, although they don't see each other very often.

definition: a usually rented room or set of rooms that is part of a building and is used as a place to live
sentence: We lived in an apartment for several years before buying a house.

definition: to act violently against (someone or something) : to try to hurt, injure, or destroy (something or someone) —often used as (be) attacked
sentence: He attacked the guard with a knife.

definition: a game in which two teams of five players bounce a ball and try to score points by throwing the ball through one of the raised nets at each end of a rectangular court —often used before another noun
sentence: My brother plays basketball on the school team.

definition: having beauty: such as
sentence: The sunset was absolutely beautiful this evening over the ocean.

definition: a hard smooth usually dark surface used especially in a classroom for writing or drawing on with chalk
sentence: The teacher wrote the important math problem on the blackboard.

definition: causing weariness and restlessness through lack of interest : causing boredom : tiresome
sentence: The movie was so boring that I fell asleep.

definition: producing a lot of light : filled with light
sentence: She's a bright child with a curious mind.

definition: the activity of making, buying, or selling goods or providing services in exchange for money —often used before another noun
sentence: Business is doing well this year.

definition: a man who transacts business; especially : a business executive
sentence: The businessman closed an important deal with his partners.

definition: to recognize a notable event (as a birthday or anniversary) by doing something special or enjoyable
sentence: Other elements of the culture, from spiritual practices to natural crafts, maintain and celebrate ties to west Africa.

definition: an electronic machine that can store and work with large amounts of information —often used before another noun
sentence: He works all day on/with a computer.

definition: involving possible injury, harm, or death : characterized by danger —often + to
sentence: As the conversation turned to politics, I knew we were heading into dangerous territory.

definition: a reference source in print or electronic form containing words usually alphabetically arranged along with information about their forms, pronunciations, functions, etymologies, meanings, and syntactic and idiomatic uses
sentence: Look it up in the dictionary.

definition: not of the same kind : partly or totally unlike —often + from, than, or to
sentence: The two brothers could not have been more different.

definition: not easy : requiring much work or skill to do or make —often followed by to + verb —often + for
sentence: Our last test was extremely difficult.

definition: being the one and the other of two : each
sentence: Flowers blooming on either side of the walk.

definition: occurring in such quantity, quality, or scope as to fully meet demands, needs, or expectations
sentence: He just doesn't know when to leave well enough alone.

definition: everyone
sentence: The teacher said everybody should bring a pencil to class tomorrow.

definition: very good : extremely good
sentence: Her new movie has received excellent reviews.

definition: causing feelings of interest and enthusiasm : causing excitement
sentence: Going to the zoo was the most exciting trip of the year.

definition: the part of the body that you see with
sentence: Her eyes slowly became accustomed to the dark.

definition: a person who runs a farm
sentence: My uncle has been a farmer for 60 years.

definition: one of the five long parts of the hand that are used for holding things; especially : one of the four that are not the thumb
sentence: The finger proved to be very useful.

definition: refrigerator
sentence: The fridge keeps food cold and fresh at home.

definition: acting like a friend : kind and helpful
sentence: Our neighbor is very friendly and always waves hello to us.

definition: a food that is made from cacao beans and that is eaten as candy or used as a flavoring ingredient in other sweet foods
sentence: The tart mousse was served in a dark chocolate cup, topped with meringue, and finished with a crisp wafer.

definition: to strike (two things, such as two flat, hard surfaces) together so as to produce a sharp percussive noise
sentence: We all love a good clapback. It's a comeback but with that extra oomph.

definition: a room where classes are taught in a school, college, or university
sentence: We arrived at the classroom just before closing time.

definition: not causing any physically unpleasant feelings : producing physical comfort
sentence: Lamb was comfortable in his ignorance of what he did not choose to know.

definition: suited to personal comfort or to easy performance
sentence: Found it convenient to deal with both problems at the same time.

definition: a sweet baked food that is usually small, flat, and round and is made from flour and sugar —often used before another noun
sentence: This recipe makes about two dozen cookies.

definition: appealing to one of the bodily senses especially of taste or smell
sentence: A delicious bit of gossip.

definition: a shaking of a part of the Earth's surface that often causes great damage —called also quake
sentence: The earthquake had great importance in our daily lives.

definition: all that exists
sentence: Put everything back in your backpack before going home.

definition: costing a lot of money
sentence: That restaurant is too expensive for my budget.

definition: the process of doing and seeing things and of having things happen to you
sentence: The best way to learn is by experience.

definition: most liked
sentence: Red is my favorite color.

definition: one who engages in fishing as an occupation or for pleasure
sentence: The fisherman cast his line into the river early morning.
